member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.AddGDBResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Adds metadata tags to a DataBrew resource, such as a dataset, project, recipe, job, or schedule.

para.para: The DataBrew resource to which tags should be added. The value for this parameter is an Amazon Resource Name (ARN). For DataBrew, you can tag a dataset, a job, a project, or a recipe.
One or more tags to be assigned to the resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.AddGDBResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.AddGDBResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.AddGDBResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.GetGDBDatasetCmdlet
member.summary: Returns the definition of a specific DataBrew dataset.

para.para: The name of the dataset to be described.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.GetGDBDatasetCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.DescribeDatasetResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.DescribeDatasetResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.GetGDBDatasetCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.GetGDBDatasetListCmdlet
member.summary: Lists all of the DataBrew datasets.

para.para: The maximum number of results to return in this request.
The token returned by a previous call to retrieve the next set of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.GetGDBDatasetListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Datasets'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.ListDatasetsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.ListDatasetsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.GetGDBJobCmdlet
member.summary: Returns the definition of a specific DataBrew job.

para.para: The name of the job to be described.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.GetGDBJobCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.DescribeJobResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.DescribeJobResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.GetGDBJobCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.GetGDBJobListCmdlet
member.summary: Lists all of the DataBrew jobs that are defined.

para.para: The name of a dataset. Using this parameter indicates to return only those jobs that act on the specified dataset.
The name of a project. Using this parameter indicates to return only those jobs that are associated with the specified project.
The maximum number of results to return in this request.

A token generated by DataBrew that specifies where to continue pagination if a previous request was truncated. To get the next set of pages, pass in the NextToken value from the response object of the previous page call.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.GetGDBJobListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Jobs'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.ListJobsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.ListJobsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.GetGDBJobListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ProjectName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ProjectName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.GetGDBJobRunCmdlet
member.summary: Represents one run of a DataBrew job.

para.para: The name of the job being processed during this run.
The unique identifier of the job run.

member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the RunId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^RunId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.GetGDBRecipeListCmdlet
member.summary: Lists all of the DataBrew recipes that are defined.

para.para: Return only those recipes with a version identifier of LATEST_WORKING or LATEST_PUBLISHED. If RecipeVersion is omitted, ListRecipes returns all of the LATEST_PUBLISHED recipe versions.
Valid values: LATEST_WORKING | LATEST_PUBLISHED
The maximum number of results to return in this request.
The token returned by a previous call to retrieve the next set of results.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBDatasetCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a new DataBrew dataset.

para.para: The Amazon S3 bucket name.
The Amazon S3 bucket name.
The Amazon S3 bucket name.
The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner.
The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner.
The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner.
The unique identifier of the Amazon Web Services account that holds the Data Catalog that stores the data.
The name of a database in the Data Catalog.
The table within the target database.
A single character that specifies the delimiter being used in the CSV file.

The expression which includes condition names followed by substitution variables, possibly grouped and combined with other conditions. For example, "(starts_with :prefix1 or starts_with :prefix2) and (ends_with :suffix1 or ends_with :suffix2)". Substitution variables should start with ':' symbol.
The file format of a dataset that is created from an Amazon S3 file or folder.
The Glue Connection that stores the connection information for the target database.
A variable that specifies whether the first row in the file is parsed as the header. If this value is false, column names are auto-generated.
A variable that specifies whether the first row in the file is parsed as the header. If this value is false, column names are auto-generated.
The unique name of the object in the bucket.
The unique name of the object in the bucket.
The unique name of the object in the bucket.
The number of Amazon S3 files to select.
A value that specifies whether JSON input contains embedded new line characters.
The name of the dataset to be created. Valid characters are alphanumeric (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), hyphen (-), period (.), and space.
A criteria to use for Amazon S3 files sorting before their selection. By default uses DESCENDING order, i.e. most recent files are selected first. Another possible value is ASCENDING.
A criteria to use for Amazon S3 files sorting before their selection. By default uses LAST_MODIFIED_DATE as a sorting criteria. Currently it's the only allowed value.
A structure that maps names of parameters used in the Amazon S3 path of a dataset to their definitions.
Custom SQL to run against the provided Glue connection. This SQL will be used as the input for DataBrew projects and jobs.
One or more sheet numbers in the Excel file that will be included in the dataset.
One or more named sheets in the Excel file that will be included in the dataset.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the dataset. Currently, DataBrew only supports ARNs from Amazon AppFlow.
The name of a database table in the Data Catalog. This table corresponds to a DataBrew dataset.
Metadata tags to apply to this dataset.
The map of substitution variable names to their values used in this filter expression.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBDatasetCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Name'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.CreateDatasetResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.CreateDatasetResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBDatasetCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBProfileJobCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a new job to analyze a dataset and create its data profile.

para.para: Configuration of statistics that are allowed to be run on columns that contain detected entities. When undefined, no statistics will be computed on columns that contain detected entities.
The Amazon S3 bucket name.
The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner.

List of configurations for column evaluations. ColumnStatisticsConfigurations are used to select evaluations and override parameters of evaluations for particular columns. When ColumnStatisticsConfigurations is undefined, the profile job will profile all supported columns and run all supported evaluations.
The name of the dataset that this job is to act upon.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an encryption key that is used to protect the job.
The encryption mode for the job, which can be one of the following:

li.para: SSE-KMS - SSE-KMS - Server-side encryption with KMS-managed keys.
SSE-S3 - Server-side encryption with keys managed by Amazon S3.

para.para: Entity types to detect. Can be any of the following:
The Entity type group USA_ALL is also supported, and includes all of the above entity types except PERSON_NAME and DATE.
List of included evaluations. When the list is undefined, all supported evaluations will be included.
The unique name of the object in the bucket.
Enables or disables Amazon CloudWatch logging for the job. If logging is enabled, CloudWatch writes one log stream for each job run.
The maximum number of nodes that DataBrew can use when the job processes data.
The maximum number of times to retry the job after a job run fails.
A value that determines whether the profile job is run on the entire dataset or a specified number of rows. This value must be one of the following:

li.para: FULL_DATASET - The profile job is run on the entire dataset.
CUSTOM_ROWS - The profile job is run on the number of rows specified in the Size parameter.

para.para: The name of the job to be created. Valid characters are alphanumeric (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), hyphen (-), period (.), and space.
List of overrides for evaluations.
List of column selectors. ProfileColumns can be used to select columns from the dataset. When ProfileColumns is undefined, the profile job will profile all supported columns.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role to be assumed when DataBrew runs the job.
The Size parameter is only required when the mode is CUSTOM_ROWS. The profile job is run on the specified number of rows. The maximum value for size is Long.MAX_VALUE.
Metadata tags to apply to this job.
The job's timeout in minutes. A job that attempts to run longer than this timeout period ends with a status of TIMEOUT.
List of validation configurations that are applied to the profile job.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBProfileJobCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Name'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.CreateProfileJobResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.CreateProfileJobResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBProfileJobCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBProfileJobCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBProjectCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a new DataBrew project.

para.para: The name of an existing dataset to associate this project with.
A unique name for the new project. Valid characters are alphanumeric (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), hyphen (-), period (.), and space.
The name of an existing recipe to associate with the project.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role to be assumed for this request.
The number of rows in the sample.
Metadata tags to apply to this project.
The way in which DataBrew obtains rows from a dataset.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBProjectCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Name'. member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBRecipeCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a new DataBrew recipe.

para.para: A description for the recipe.
A unique name for the recipe. Valid characters are alphanumeric (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), hyphen (-), period (.), and space.
An array containing the steps to be performed by the recipe. Each recipe step consists of one recipe action and (optionally) an array of condition expressions.
Metadata tags to apply to this recipe.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBRecipeCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Name'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.CreateRecipeResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.CreateRecipeResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBRecipeCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBRecipeJobCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a new job to transform input data, using steps defined in an existing Glue DataBrew recipe

para.para: Represents a list of JDBC database output objects which defines the output destination for a DataBrew recipe job to write to.
One or more artifacts that represent the Glue Data Catalog output from running the job.
The name of the dataset that this job processes.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an encryption key that is used to protect the job.
The encryption mode for the job, which can be one of the following:

li.para: SSE-KMS - Server-side encryption with keys managed by KMS.
SSE-S3 - Server-side encryption with keys managed by Amazon S3.

para.para: Enables or disables Amazon CloudWatch logging for the job. If logging is enabled, CloudWatch writes one log stream for each job run.
The maximum number of nodes that DataBrew can consume when the job processes data.
The maximum number of times to retry the job after a job run fails.
A unique name for the job. Valid characters are alphanumeric (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), hyphen (-), period (.), and space.
The name of the recipe.
One or more artifacts that represent the output from running the job.
Either the name of an existing project, or a combination of a recipe and a dataset to associate with the recipe.
The identifier for the version for the recipe.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role to be assumed when DataBrew runs the job.
Metadata tags to apply to this job.
The job's timeout in minutes. A job that attempts to run longer than this timeout period ends with a status of TIMEOUT.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBRecipeJobCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Name'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.CreateRecipeJobResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.CreateRecipeJobResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBRecipeJobCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBRecipeJobCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.NewGDBRulesetCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a new ruleset that can be used in a profile job to validate the data quality of a dataset.

para.para: The description of the ruleset.
The name of the ruleset to be created. Valid characters are alphanumeric (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), hyphen (-), period (.), and space.
A list of rules that are defined with the ruleset. A rule includes one or more checks to be validated on a DataBrew dataset.
Metadata tags to apply to the ruleset.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a resource (dataset) that the ruleset is associated with.

The name or names of one or more jobs to be run.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.RemoveGDBRecipeVersionBatchCmdlet
member.summary:
Deletes one or more versions of a recipe at a time.
The entire request will be rejected if:
The recipe does not exist.
There is an invalid version identifier in the list of versions.
The version list is empty.
The version list size exceeds 50.
The version list contains duplicate entries.
The request will complete successfully, but with partial failures, if:
A version does not exist.
A version is being used by a job.
You specify LATEST_WORKING, but it's being used by a project.
The version fails to be deleted.
The LATEST_WORKING version will only be deleted if the recipe has no other versions. If you try to delete LATEST_WORKING while other versions exist (or if they can't be deleted), then LATEST_WORKING will be listed as partial failure in the response.

para.para: The name of the recipe whose versions are to be deleted.
An array of version identifiers, for the recipe versions to be deleted. You can specify numeric versions (X.Y) or LATEST_WORKING. LATEST_PUBLISHED is not supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.RemoveGDBRecipeVersionBatchCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.BatchDeleteRecipeVersionResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.SendGDBProjectSessionActionCmdlet
member.summary: Performs a recipe step within an interactive DataBrew session that's currently open.

para.para: Controls if analytics computation is enabled or disabled. Enabled by default.
A unique identifier for an interactive session that's currently open and ready for work. The action will be performed on this session.
The number of columns to include in the view frame, beginning with the StartColumnIndex value and ignoring any columns in the HiddenColumns list.
One or more conditions that must be met for the recipe step to succeed.

note.para: All of the conditions in the array must be met. In other words, all of the conditions must be combined using a logical AND operation.

para.para: A list of columns to hide in the view frame.
The name of the project to apply the action to.
The name of a valid DataBrew transformation to be performed on the data.
Contextual parameters for the transformation.
If true, the result of the recipe step will be returned, but not applied.
The number of rows to include in the view frame, beginning with the StartRowIndex value.
The starting index for the range of columns to return in the view frame.
The starting index for the range of rows to return in the view frame.
The index from which to preview a step. This index is used to preview the result of steps that have already been applied, so that the resulting view frame is from earlier in the view frame stack.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.SendGDBProjectSessionActionCmdlet.Select

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.UpdateGDBDatasetCmdlet
member.summary: Modifies the definition of an existing DataBrew dataset.

para.para: The Amazon S3 bucket name.
The Amazon S3 bucket name.
The Amazon S3 bucket name.
The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner.
The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner.
The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner.
The unique identifier of the Amazon Web Services account that holds the Data Catalog that stores the data.
The name of a database in the Data Catalog.
The table within the target database.
A single character that specifies the delimiter being used in the CSV file.

The expression which includes condition names followed by substitution variables, possibly grouped and combined with other conditions. For example, "(starts_with :prefix1 or starts_with :prefix2) and (ends_with :suffix1 or ends_with :suffix2)". Substitution variables should start with ':' symbol.
The file format of a dataset that is created from an Amazon S3 file or folder.
The Glue Connection that stores the connection information for the target database.
A variable that specifies whether the first row in the file is parsed as the header. If this value is false, column names are auto-generated.
A variable that specifies whether the first row in the file is parsed as the header. If this value is false, column names are auto-generated.
The unique name of the object in the bucket.
The unique name of the object in the bucket.
The unique name of the object in the bucket.
The number of Amazon S3 files to select.
A value that specifies whether JSON input contains embedded new line characters.
The name of the dataset to be updated.
A criteria to use for Amazon S3 files sorting before their selection. By default uses DESCENDING order, i.e. most recent files are selected first. Another possible value is ASCENDING.
A criteria to use for Amazon S3 files sorting before their selection. By default uses LAST_MODIFIED_DATE as a sorting criteria. Currently it's the only allowed value.
A structure that maps names of parameters used in the Amazon S3 path of a dataset to their definitions.
Custom SQL to run against the provided Glue connection. This SQL will be used as the input for DataBrew projects and jobs.
One or more sheet numbers in the Excel file that will be included in the dataset.
One or more named sheets in the Excel file that will be included in the dataset.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the dataset. Currently, DataBrew only supports ARNs from Amazon AppFlow.
The name of a database table in the Data Catalog. This table corresponds to a DataBrew dataset.
The map of substitution variable names to their values used in this filter expression.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.UpdateGDBDatasetCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Name'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.UpdateDatasetResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.UpdateDatasetResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.UpdateGDBProfileJobCmdlet
member.summary: Modifies the definition of an existing profile job.

para.para: Configuration of statistics that are allowed to be run on columns that contain detected entities. When undefined, no statistics will be computed on columns that contain detected entities.
The Amazon S3 bucket name.
The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner.

List of configurations for column evaluations. ColumnStatisticsConfigurations are used to select evaluations and override parameters of evaluations for particular columns. When ColumnStatisticsConfigurations is undefined, the profile job will profile all supported columns and run all supported evaluations.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an encryption key that is used to protect the job.
The encryption mode for the job, which can be one of the following:

li.para: SSE-KMS - Server-side encryption with keys managed by KMS.
SSE-S3 - Server-side encryption with keys managed by Amazon S3.

para.para: Entity types to detect. Can be any of the following:
The Entity type group USA_ALL is also supported, and includes all of the above entity types except PERSON_NAME and DATE.
List of included evaluations. When the list is undefined, all supported evaluations will be included.
The unique name of the object in the bucket.
Enables or disables Amazon CloudWatch logging for the job. If logging is enabled, CloudWatch writes one log stream for each job run.
The maximum number of compute nodes that DataBrew can use when the job processes data.
The maximum number of times to retry the job after a job run fails.
A value that determines whether the profile job is run on the entire dataset or a specified number of rows. This value must be one of the following:

li.para: FULL_DATASET - The profile job is run on the entire dataset.
CUSTOM_ROWS - The profile job is run on the number of rows specified in the Size parameter.

para.para: The name of the job to be updated.
List of overrides for evaluations.
List of column selectors. ProfileColumns can be used to select columns from the dataset. When ProfileColumns is undefined, the profile job will profile all supported columns.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role to be assumed when DataBrew runs the job.
The Size parameter is only required when the mode is CUSTOM_ROWS. The profile job is run on the specified number of rows. The maximum value for size is Long.MAX_VALUE.
The job's timeout in minutes. A job that attempts to run longer than this timeout period ends with a status of TIMEOUT.
List of validation configurations that are applied to the profile job.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.UpdateGDBProfileJobCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Name'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.UpdateProfileJobResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.UpdateProfileJobResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.UpdateGDBProfileJobCmdlet.PassThru

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.UpdateGDBProjectCmdlet
member.summary: Modifies the definition of an existing DataBrew project.

para.para: The name of the project to be updated.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be assumed for this request.
The number of rows in the sample.
The way in which DataBrew obtains rows from a dataset.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.UpdateGDBProjectCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.UpdateProjectResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.UpdateProjectResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Modifies the definition of the LATEST_WORKING version of a DataBrew recipe.

para.para: A description of the recipe.
The name of the recipe to be updated.
One or more steps to be performed by the recipe. Each step consists of an action, and the conditions under which the action should succeed.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.GDB.UpdateGDBRecipeJobCmdlet
member.summary: Modifies the definition of an existing DataBrew recipe job.

para.para: Represents a list of JDBC database output objects which defines the output destination for a DataBrew recipe job to write into.
One or more artifacts that represent the Glue Data Catalog output from running the job.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an encryption key that is used to protect the job.
The encryption mode for the job, which can be one of the following:

li.para: SSE-KMS - Server-side encryption with keys managed by KMS.
SSE-S3 - Server-side encryption with keys managed by Amazon S3.

para.para: Enables or disables Amazon CloudWatch logging for the job. If logging is enabled, CloudWatch writes one log stream for each job run.
The maximum number of nodes that DataBrew can consume when the job processes data.
The maximum number of times to retry the job after a job run fails.
The name of the job to update.
One or more artifacts that represent the output from running the job.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role to be assumed when DataBrew runs the job.
The job's timeout in minutes. A job that attempts to run longer than this timeout period ends with a status of TIMEOUT.

Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.UpdateRecipeJobResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.GlueDataBrew.Model.UpdateRecipeJobResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
